abstract: Court in Paris finds French comedian Dieudonne M’bala M’bala guilty of condoning terrorism in January Facebook message in which he suggested sympathy with one of gunmen involved in attack on newspaper Charlie Hebdo in Paris; charge is made under national law meant to rein in speech supporting terrorism, and he is given two-month suspended prison sentence.
lead_paragraph: Dieudonné M’bala M’bala was found guilty for a Facebook message that suggested sympathy with one of the gunmen in the deadly attacks in Paris.

headline.main: Dieudonné M’bala M’bala, French Comedian, Convicted of Condoning Terrorism
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; France: Comedian’s Facebook Post Condoned Terrorism, Court Says

snippet: Dieudonné M’bala M’bala was found guilty for a Facebook message that suggested sympathy with one of the gunmen in the deadly attacks in Paris.
